page.title: 10Welbeck Estate Lodges
page.content: On the Welbeck Estate part of the block there are some old stone buildings, all of which are listed. There are three lodges on the estate. The Lion Gate is the 'back entrance' to Welbeck Abbey. The drive was built specifically for the Duke of Portland and Royalty. It was covered in red gravel and every time a carriage went over it the tracks would have to be swept over by workers who were employed to keep it free from leaves. The Lion Gate lodge was built in 1884 to house the gate keeper who could be called out night or day to open the gates wearing a top hat and tails.The White Gates lodge was built by another set of gates further up the drive. This formed part of a relay system starting with a ringing bell which would be passed to Lion Gates. Also there is Tunnel End Lodge(p.9)
